result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Lamont Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. As to all costs and surcharge. Court orders: DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds. Remaining balance to be paid during the period of ES. Any unpaid balance to convert to a civil judgment.

12-30-15/ Judge Frederick C Rosa
The Court ordered the JOC amended to reflect a total of 203 days of sentence  credit. *******************



CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Order on Petition for Civil Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations; signed, filed, and distributed. 
THE COURT ORDERS:
Court Financial Obligations. 
Judgment is granted against the Defendant for other unpaid Court Ordered Financial Obligations in the amount of $348.70. 
The Clerk is directed to enter this judgment on the judgment and lien docket without fee. Interest will be added from the date of entry of judgment at the rate allowed by statute.
THIS IS A FINAL ORDER FOR THE PURPOSE OF APPEAL.

DOC request to review order for sentence credit.
Original Transcript (31 pages) commencing 11/04/2015 CHANGE OF PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE, with credit for 218 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. 
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders: DOC shall collect up to 25% prison funds. Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision. Any unpaid balance to convert to a civil judgment. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Derrick Lamont Johnson in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Derrick Lamont Johnson in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders penalty enhancer DISMISSED.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Derrick Lamont Johnson not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter may be in resolution posture.  Court orders matter adjourned  If matter does NOT resolve on next date, matter to be re-assigned per Chief Judge Directive 15-19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Original PRELIMINARY HEARING AND ARRAIGNMENT Transcript (11 pages) commencing 04/27/2015 received and filed.  CH

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Derrick Lamont Johnson not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl for Hanna Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel just received discovery and requested more time to review the materials. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Derrick Lamont Johnson not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl for Hanna Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel was recently appointed and is requesting additional status date. Discovery was not turned over from prior counsel.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derrick Lamont Johnson in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Derrick Lamont Johnson in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago for Hanna Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for plea hearing. Court hears argument re: defense motion to withdraw. Court GRANTS request, counsel has already notified OPD's office.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
- to withdraw as counsel for the defendant, filed.

Defendant Derrick Lamont Johnson in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Derrick Lamont Johnson in custody.  Ronald Dague for  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Larry Schimke-MPD Detective. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #09CF5366 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Derrick Lamont Johnson in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Derrick Lamont Johnson in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss by defense FOR LACK OF PROBABLE CAUSE argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
